page.title: 09EDUCATION-Duddon C.E.School
page.content:
The present{Duddon, Clotton and {Hoofield Church of England(Controlled) {School was built in 1880.}The building has changed little since this time although some alteration of space has taken place, and over half of the present school population of 93 is now housed in two temporary, mobile classrooms. Plans to re-model the school have been proposed and it is hoped that these plans will secure the future of the school into the 21st. century!
Pupils were originally drawn from the official 'catchment' zone, comprising of the parishes of Duddon, Clotton, Burton and Hoofield. Today over half the pupils come from other parishes including those of Tarporley, Tarvin, Oscroft and Willington. At present there are five teachers.
